channel.title: [317] Custom Crown help
channel.description:
Ok.. So I've been working on this for awhile, but have gotten no where. Everything everyone tries to say doesn't really work.. I found this code in client.java (Client sided..)
aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_869 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(class44_2, "redstone2", 0); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_869.method358(0); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_869.method359(true); for (int l4 = 0; l4 < 3; l4++) { [b] aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2( class44_2, "mod_icons", l4);[/b] } Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1( class44_2, "backleft1", 0);
I don't know how much of it is for that exact mod_icons part but whatever.. Now.. I added a crown to the cache and it's number 2. So Mod=0, Admin=1, Owner=3 [img]http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/494/317cachecrowns.png[/img] How do I get it to show up now? What exactly am I supposed to change. I know it's rare that any of these get answered because there are so many topics like it. But any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.. Ethan

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @Ebowne24 Ebowne24
item.description:
@Ebowne24 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:9, topic:323363”][quote author=Destruction link=topic=419764.msg3088306#msg3088306 date=1262667997]
You had it right, just make the background white instead of pink.
[/quote][quote author=badger41 link=topic=419764.msg3088767#msg3088767 date=1262725229]

You had it right, just make the background white instead of pink.

only make the background pink if you are importing it into the cache.
[/quote]

Both of you are incorrect. White is when it loads as a sprite, aka through Pixel Loading.
Pinkish color, is automatically defined in the client’s cache as a transparency.
But when the clients were made it was made off a Windows Xp, and the color had changed since moving to Vista/Windows 7 computers, so your pink maybe be off.[/quote]
But regardless, it still shows the private chat crowns wrong and I still don’t have the owner crown showing up.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Destruction:

You had it right, just make the background white instead of pink.

You had it right, just make the background white instead of pink.
[/quote]

only make the background pink if you are importing it into the cache.[/quote]

Both of you are incorrect. White is when it loads as a sprite, aka through Pixel Loading.
Pinkish color, is automatically defined in the client’s cache as a transparency.
But when the clients were made it was made off a Windows Xp, and the color had changed since moving to Vista/Windows 7 computers, so your pink maybe be off.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Destruction:

You had it right, just make the background white instead of pink.

only make the background pink if you are importing it into the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @Destruction Destruction
item.description:
@Destruction wrote:

You had it right, just make the background white instead of pink.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Ebowne24, post:5, topic:323363”]I know how to just change the mod icons in the cache, but not add any. I found a guide on it on r-s but now I’ve come across another problem. This is what I posted over there…

[quote]Thanks

if (playerRights == 3) { out.write(3); //Crown fixup } else { out.write(playerRights); // mod level }
The things I’ve done to try to get it to work… I know it goes it client class because I’ve messed with it before…

I either:
Add it along with this one but change the one I currently had to “playerRights == 2”:

// mod/admin level crown fix -bakatool if (playerRights == 3) out.write(2); else out.write(playerRights);
Edit the one I already have to make it match the one you provided.
But either way I do it, it nulls my server or client…[/quote][/quote]

Ebow, its the correct server sided code, but the tutorial on their is fucked up, im thinking about making a correct one.

if (playerRights == 3) out.write(2);

Basicly add shit under that.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @Ebowne24 Ebowne24
item.description:
@Ebowne24 wrote:

I know how to just change the mod icons in the cache, but not add any. I found a guide on it on r-s but now I’ve come across another problem. This is what I posted over there…

Thanks [code]if (playerRights == 3) { out.write(3); //Crown fixup } else { out.write(playerRights); // mod level }[/code] The things I've done to try to get it to work.. I know it goes it client class because I've messed with it before..

I either:
Add it along with this one but change the one I currently had to “playerRights == 2”:

// mod/admin level crown fix -bakatool if (playerRights == 3) out.write(2); else out.write(playerRights);
Edit the one I already have to make it match the one you provided.
But either way I do it, it nulls my server or client…

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

if your overwriting the image in the cache, isnt there no need to modify any of the code in the client? unlesss your client doesnt load modicons yet?

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @Ebowne24 Ebowne24
item.description:
@Ebowne24 wrote:

There is no picture of it in my sprites.
They are all .jag files with the exception of a few .png files.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2010, 08:20:49 pm[/size][hr]Followed this tutorial: Followed this tutorial: http://www.google.org/showthread.php?t=61359
Ok… What I did was just delete the mod_icons.dat from my cache (The reason I did this was because I am going to continue another tutorial on how to add extra crowns using Galkon’s tutorial first - I’m not sure of how to do this editing the cache so I did it this way…) and do Galkon’s tutorial. It added them right I’m presuming because it has the crowns I want, but it now has the fuchsia background to it on the chatbox and it doesn’t show the same crown for let’s say… a Moderator from the split pm and non-split.
This is what I mean…:

And this is what I named them in my “Sprites” folder:

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

You have to make it load the sprite also, the snap shot of “mod_icons” is where is loading from/
Galkon made a tutorial on how to make it load, just change the player rights to 3.

Then you also have to do it server sided.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Custom Crown help
item.dc:creator: @Ebowne24 Ebowne24
item.description:
@Ebowne24 wrote:

Ok… So I’ve been working on this for awhile, but have gotten no where. Everything everyone tries to say doesn’t really work…
I found this code in client.java (Client sided…)

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_869 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(class44_2, "redstone2", 0); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_869.method358(0); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_869.method359(true); for (int l4 = 0; l4 < 3; l4++) { [b] aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2( class44_2, "mod_icons", l4);[/b] } 
        Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(
                class44_2, "backleft1", 0);</blockquote>

I don’t know how much of it is for that exact mod_icons part but whatever…
Now… I added a crown to the cache and it’s number 2.
So Mod=0, Admin=1, Owner=3

How do I get it to show up now? What exactly am I supposed to change.

I know it’s rare that any of these get answered because there are so many topics like it.
But any help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks…
Ethan
